Here's the same map, but overlayed with the borders of Luhansk, Donetsk, Zaporizhzhia, and Kherson Oblasts.

Percentage of the different regions of Ukraine controlled by Russia, as of January 1, 2026:
Crimea + Sevastopol: 100%
Luhansk Oblast: 99.80%
Donetsk Oblast: 80.92%
(Donbas total: 90.38%)
Zaporizhzhia Oblast: 75.50%
Kherson Oblast: 71.08%
(4 Oblasts total: 81.59%)
Kharkiv Oblast: 5.37%
Dnipropetrovsk Oblast: 1.39%
Sumy Oblast: 1.20%
Mykolaiv Oblast: 0.54%

Current statuses of the different cities in the 4 Oblasts claimed by Russia, as of January 1, 2026:
Luhansk Oblast: 
- 37 controlled by Russia
- 0 controlled by Ukraine
- 0 contested
Donetsk Oblast:
- 40 controlled by Russia
- 8 controlled by Ukraine
- 4 contested
Zaporizhzhia Oblast:
- 11 controlled by Russia
- 3 controlled by Ukraine
- 0 contested
Kherson Oblast:
- 7 controlled by Russia
- 2 controlled by Ukraine
- 0 contested
Additionally, Russia controls 1 city in Kharkiv Oblast (Vovchansk), and another is contested (Kupyansk), out of a total of 18 in the region.
The remaining cities not controlled by Russia in the 4 Oblasts are the following:
Donetsk Oblast
: Slovyansk, Kramatorsk, Mykolaivka, Dobropillya, Bilytske, Bilozerske, Druzhkivka, Svyatohirsk, Rodynske (contested), Kostyantynivka (contested), Chasiv Yar (contested), and Lyman (contested).
Zaporizhzhia Oblast:
 Zaporizhzhia City, Orikhiv, and Vilnyansk.
Kherson Oblast
: Kherson City and Beryslav. 
Out of a total of 112 cities in the 4 Oblasts: 
- Russia controls 95
- Ukraine controls 13
- 4 more are contested

Multiple Ukrainian drones struck a cafe in the village of Khorly, Russian-controlled Kherson Oblast, where residents were celebrating New Years Eve.
At least 24 civilians were killed and 50 others injured.

Multiple Ukrainian drones struck a cafe in the village of Khorly, Russian-controlled Kherson Oblast, where residents were celebrating New Years Eve.
At least 24 civilians were killed and 50 others injured.
Kh-59/69 cruise missile to Hadyach, Poltava Oblast.
Kh-59/69 cruise missile to Hadyach, Poltava Oblast.

Approximate path so far.
It's flying in the direction of Lubny/Hrebinka, Poltava Oblast.
Changed course to Lubny, flying in from the north
Changed course again, flying towards Drabiv, Cherkasy Oblast.
Changed course again, flying towards Drabiv, Cherkasy Oblast.

Now approaching Drabiv from the northeast.
Altitude: 500m
The missile impacted Kaniv. An explosion was heard. The target doesn't appear to have been the hydroelectric power plant.

The Russian MOD announced that a Ukrainian Su-27 fighter was shot down yesterday.
It appears that it was shot down over northern Zaporizhzhia Oblast by an R-37 air-to-air missile launched by a Russian Su-35 in the vicinity of Kam'yanka, Zaporizhzhia Oblast, as the Su-27 was approaching its launch lines to launch glide-bombs at Russian positions (likely in the Hulyaipole direction).
While this is not 100% confirmed yet, it seems very likely. What's interesting is that, unlike usual, the Su-35 wasn't covering any Su-34s launching KAB glide-bombs and may have been circling in the area for the Ukrainian jets to arrive.

The Era Of Collapse: How 2025 Rewrote The History Of War And Peace
The winter of 2025 in Eastern Europe has been cold‚Äîcold in the weather report, and colder still in the geopolitical ledger. Rewind the tape twelve months and you can hear the bravado of Kiev‚Äôs telethons, the promise of returning to the ‚Äú1991 borders,‚Äù and the endless parade of Western politicians swearing they would stand ‚Äúas long as it takes.‚Äù Today, on December 31, that noise is gone. In its place hangs a heavy, syrupy quiet over Bankova Street, Brussels, and Washington‚Äîthe kind of quiet that settles in only when people begin to accept what can‚Äôt be talked away.
2025 didn‚Äôt merely move the line of contact. It snapped the spine of the conflict‚Äôs underlying idea. The ‚Äúpositional deadlock‚Äù Western analysts loved to debate throughout 2024 shattered against a different Russian approach: a steamroller strategy‚Äîslow, grinding, and, once it starts rolling downhill, brutally hard to stop. This became the war‚Äôs most honest year. 
üëâ

Russian MoD Shares Details On Ukrainian Attempt To Attack Putin‚Äôs Residency With Over 90 Drones 
The Russian Ministry of Defense has finally shared the details of the Ukrainian attempt to attack the presidency of President Vladimir Putin in the Novgorod region over the night of December 28 and 29.
In a press briefing on December 31, Chief of the Air Defense Missile Forces of the Russian Aerospace Forces Major General Aleksandr Romanenkov said that ‚Äúa large number of long-range unmanned aerial vehicles‚Äù were used in the attack.
The attack was first detected around 19.20 local time of December 28 by radio-technical units of the Russian Aerospace Forces, according to the commander, who said that ‚Äúfixed-wing unmanned aerial vehicles operating at extremely low altitudes‚Äù were detected over the Ukrainian regions of Sumy and Chernigov.

Saudi Arabia Shares More Footage From Attack On Emirate Arms In Yemen As Tensions Mount 
The Saudi-led Arab Coalition has released a statement providing more details about its airstrikes on an arms shipment sent by the United Arab Emirates to its allies in Yemen.
The statement, issued late on December 30 by coalition spokesman Col. Turki al-Maliki, came in response to a statement ‚Äçby the the United Arab Emirate saying that ‚Äçthe shipment ‚Äçin question ‚Å†did ‚Äånot contain ‚Å†weapons ‚Äçand were destined for the ‚Å†Emirati forces.

Russian Army Expands Its Control Near Krasny Liman, Pokrovsk & Stepnogorsk (Videos)
On December 31, the Russian military made gains near the key cities of Krasny Liman and Pokrovsk in Donetsk, as well as close to the large settlement of Stepnogorsk in Zaporozhye.
The Zapad [West] Group of Forces advanced to the north of Krasny Liman, mainly around Yarova. Russian troops expanded their control in the northern outskirts of the settlement, then pushed to the east and south of it, reaching the right bank of the Siverskyi Donets River for the first time in this area.
Moving to the west in Donetsk, the Tsentr [Center] Group of Forces is advancing to the north of Pokrovsk at slow, but steady rate.
Further to the west in Zaporozhye, the operations of the Vostok [East] Group of Forces around Stepnogorsk are still gaining momentum amid an apparent collapse in Ukrainian defenses.
Read more 
HERE

On December 31, the Russian military made gains near the key cities of Krasny Liman and Pokrovsk in Donetsk, as well as close to the large settlement of Stepnogorsk in Zaporozhye.

Moving to the west in Donetsk, the Tsentr [Center] Group of Forces is advancing to the north of Pokrovsk at slow, but steady rate.
Further to the west in Zaporozhye, the operations of the Vostok [East] Group of Forces around Stepnogorsk are still gaining momentum amid an apparent collapse in Ukrainian defenses.
